item.title: Running a VSAN PoC - Customer reactions
item.author: yourname@example.com (Christian Mohn)
item.description: I recently set up a VMware Virtual SAN 6.1 Proof-of-Concept for a customer, configuring a 3-node cluster based on the following setup: Hardware: HP ProLiant DL380 G9 2 x Intel Xeon E5-2680 @ 2.50Ghz w/12 Cores 392 GB RAM 1 x Intel DC 3700 800GB NVMe 6 x Intel DC S3610 1.4TB SSD HP FlexFabric 556FLR-SFP+ 10GBe NICs Virtual SAN Setup: Since this was a simple PoC setup, the VSAN was configured with 1 disk group pr host with all 6 Intel DC S3610 drives used as the capacity layer, and the Intel DC P3700 NVMe cards set up as the cache.
